summary: Gaza, located in Palestine, is a significant coastal city with a rich history dating back to at least 1500 BC. It has been ruled by various groups, including Egyptians, Philistines, Romans, and Ottomans. The city flourished under Islamic rule and became a center for trade. Gaza's modern history involves British rule during World War I and becoming part of Mandatory Palestine. After the 1948 war, Egypt controlled Gaza, and later, it was transferred to the Palestinian Authority. Hamas took power in 2007, leading to an Israeli-Egyptian blockade. The 2023 Israel-Hamas war caused massive destruction and displacement in Gaza.
title: Gaza City
